__TOC__


Here we have a sampling of bugs to work on for Hug Day.  After you have triaged or fixed a bug put your name in the last column and set the row's background to green by adding '''lightgreen''' in the first cell of the column after "background-color:" and before ";".  This will let people know that the bug in that row has been hugged.

You might find it more convenient to edit the wiki page using <code>editmoin</code> a command line utility for editing moinmoin wiki pages.  It is available as a package in Gutsy and Hardy.  More information including an easier way to do this was <nowiki>[[https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/ubuntu-bugsquad/2007-November/000666.html|mailed]]</nowiki> to the Bug Squad.

Our focus today is on bug reports regarding hal, the hardware abstraction layer, which deals with ways of connecting devices to your computer.  <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/DebuggingHal|Debugging procedures]]</nowiki> for hal are available and are part of the <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/DebuggingProcedures|debugging series]]</nowiki>.  Hal bug reports are frequently dependent on specific hardware but that doesn't prevent us from gathering the necessary information and confirming the bug report.

=== 167 New bug reports about hal ===
These are New and probably untriaged bug reports about hal.

'''To mark it off the list you should:'''
* Ask the reporter for more information set the status to Incomplete and subscribe to the bug report '''or'''
* Assign the bug to the proper package if it isn't a hal bug '''or'''
* If the bug report is complete set the bug's status to Confirmed '''or'''
* Convert the bug to a question if it is really a support question
